qas.question: In what century did the Pan-Germanisms origins begin?
What movement came out of the French Revolution?
Who ruled central and Eastern Europe during the 19th century?
What wars took place in the 1900's?
What movement began in Germany in the 1900's?
What people had been united since the Reformation?
What German wanted to unite all the ethnic-German people?

context: Pan-Germanism's origins began in the early <a0_0>19th<a0_0/> century following the <b5_0>Napoleonic Wars<b5_0/>. The wars launched a new movement that was born in France itself during the French Revolution. <a1_0><b6_0>Nationalism<b6_0/><a1_0/> during the 19th century threatened the old <a2_0>aristocratic regimes<a2_0/>. Many ethnic groups of Central and Eastern Europe had been divided for centuries, ruled over by the old Monarchies of the <a3_0>Romanovs and the Habsburgs<a3_0/>. <b7_0>Germans<b7_0/>, for the most part, had been a loose and disunited people since the Reformation when the Holy Roman Empire was shattered into a patchwork of states. The new German nationalists, mostly young reformers such as <b8_0>Johann Tillmann<b8_0/> of <a4_0>East Prussia<a4_0/>, sought to unite all the German-speaking and ethnic-German (Volksdeutsche) people.
